  • Method Details

    • recoveryChallenge

      @RequestMapping(method=POST, value="/recovery/challenge", produces="application/json", consumes={"application/x-www-form-urlencoded","application/json"}) org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ResponseRecoveryChallenge> recoveryChallenge(@Valid @RequestParam(value="recoveryID",required=true) @Valid UUID recoveryID, @Valid @RequestParam(value="recoveryToken",required=true) @Valid String recoveryToken, @Valid @RequestParam(value="challenge",required=true) @Valid String challenge)
      POST /recovery/challenge : Verifies the recovery challenge code and token from the recovery initiation step. When a user initiates a password recovery, they are sent a unique challenge code (via email, SMS, or another medium) and a signed token in the response. The client must submit this code along with the signed token to confirm their identity. Upon successful verification, the server responds with another signed token and its validity period (in seconds) in response. The user can reset their password by submitting the new password along with the signed token within the specified expiration time. If the provided code is invalid, expired, or does not match the expected challenge, the server will respond with an appropriate error message. The token should be kept secure by client to prevent unauthorized access.
      Parameters:
      recoveryID - An unique ID to identify the recovery process for a user. (required)
      recoveryToken - A token signed by the server for validating recovery process. This token is required to be sent at each of the succeeding step to verify the authenticity of the recovery process. (required)
      challenge - (required)
      Returns:
      Recovery challenge verified successfully. A signed token and its validity period are returned for resetting the password. (status code 200) or The input is invalid or missing required fields. (status code 400) or The user does not have permission to perform this action. (status code 403)

    • recoveryInitiate

      @RequestMapping(method=POST, value="/recovery/initiate", produces="application/json", consumes={"application/x-www-form-urlencoded","application/json"}) org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ResponseRecoveryInitiate> recoveryInitiate(@Valid @RequestParam(value="email",required=true) @Valid String email)
      POST /recovery/initiate : Generates a password reset OTP and sends it via email or other channels. This route generates a password reset OTP and sends it via either email, mobile number, or a seperate medium. A signed token is also generated and sent in the response of this request. The user must submit both the OTP (sent via a seperate medium) and the signed token (sent as a response to this) to verify the request and proceed with account recovery.
      Parameters:
      email - (required)
      Returns:
      Recovery OTP generated and queued to be sent via a seperate medium. A signed token is sent as a response which is required to be sent while resetting the password. (status code 200) or The input provided is invalid or missing required fields. (status code 400) or Authentication is invalid or missing. (status code 401) or The user does not exist in the system. (status code 404)

    • recoveryReset

      @RequestMapping(method=POST, value="/recovery/reset", produces="application/json", consumes={"application/x-www-form-urlencoded","application/json"}) org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ResponseSuccessMessage> recoveryReset(@Valid @RequestParam(value="recoveryID",required=true) @Valid UUID recoveryID, @Valid @RequestParam(value="recoveryToken",required=true) @Valid String recoveryToken, @Valid @RequestParam(value="newPassword",required=true) @Valid String newPassword)
      POST /recovery/reset : Resets the user's password using the recovery challenge token and new password. This route allows the user to reset their password by submitting the new password along with the signed token received during the recovery challenge step. The token must be submitted within the specified expiration time. The server will validate the token and the new password before resetting it. If the token is invalid, expired, or incorrect, an appropriate error message will be returned. Upon successful password reset, the server responds with a success message. The user can now log in with their new password.
      Parameters:
      recoveryID - An unique ID to identify the recovery process for a user. (required)
      recoveryToken - A token signed by the server for validating recovery process. This token is required to be sent at each of the succeeding step to verify the authenticity of the recovery process. (required)
      newPassword - (required)
      Returns:
      Password reset successful. The user can now log in with the new password. (status code 200) or The input is invalid or missing required fields. (status code 400) or Invalid or expired token. (status code 401) or The token is incorrect or has been tampered with. (status code 403) or The user does not exist in the system or the token is invalid. (status code 404)
